item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Robert Collier
item.description: "Visualize this thing you want. See it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blueprint and begin." -- Robert Collier

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Oprah Winfrey
item.description: "The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams." -- Oprah Winfrey

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "Ideas come from everything" -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Germaine Greer
item.description: "A library is a place where you can lose your innocence without losing your virginity." -- Germaine Greer

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "In my fool hardy youth, when my friends were dreaming of heroic deeds in the realms of engineering and law, finance and national politics, I dreamt of becoming a librarian. " -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Paul Valery
item.description: "Poems are never finished - just abandoned" -- Paul Valery

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Life is an opportunity, benefit from it. Life is beauty, admire it. Life is a dream, realize it. Life is a challenge, meet it. Life is a duty, complete it. Life is a game, play it. Life is a promise, fulfill it. Life is sorrow, overcome it. Life is a song, sing it. Life is a struggle, accept it. Life is a tragedy, confront it. Life is an adventure, dare it. Life is luck, make it. Life is too precious, do not destroy it. Life is life, fight for it." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
Anonymous add a quote by Helen Exley
item.description: "Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled "This could change your life." -- Helen Exley

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "Find your quiet center of life and write from that to the world." -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "The end of a novel, like the end of children’s dinner-party, must be made up of sweetmeats and sugar-plum" -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Every book has a soul, the soul of the person who wrote it and the soul of those who read it and dream about it." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Anonymous add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón
